intro: Blitum hybridum, commonly known as the hybrid blite, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like sorrel and buckwheat. The plant features succulent, spoon-shaped leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating, known as farina. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in late spring to early summer. Blitum hybridum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
